results.firPara: Andrea Pirlo says MLS must scrap its salary cap and end its restrictions on foreign players if it wants to keep pace with the Chinese Super Leagues riches.
results.secPara: Pirlo, who helped his New York City FC team to a 4-0 win over DC United on Sunday, said that if it wants to compete, MLS has got to get rid of any restrictions on transfers and end the rule which allows only three so-called designated players to earn big money beyond each teams set budget.
results.webTitle: MLS must scrap salary cap to compete with China, says Andrea Pirlo

results.firPara: Mark Warburton has been confirmed as the new manager of Nottingham Forest on a two-and-a-half-year contract.
results.secPara: Warburton returns to management a little over a month after leaving Rangers in somewhat confusing circumstances, with the Glasgow club insisting he had resigned from the post and the 54-year-old insisting he had been sacked.
results.webTitle: Mark Warburton confirmed as new manager of Nottingham Forest

results.firPara: Our resident cartoonist looks back on the tear-ups, flare-ups, gatecrashing and manager-bashing that went on in the last-eight ties of the competition
results.webTitle: David Squires on … the FA Cup quarter-finals

results.firPara: Heightened security measures will be in place at AFC Wimbledons Kingsmeadow stadium on Tuesday night for the highly charged first home match against MK Dons, the club that took away the old Wimbledon to Milton Keynes 15 years ago.
results.secPara: The progress of the supporter-owned AFC Wimbledon since their resurrection then, beginning in English footballs ninth tier, has been so remarkable they start the match above MK Dons in League One, as they have been for much of this season.
results.webTitle: AFC Wimbledon heighten security for first visit of MK Dons
Football transfer rumours: Arsenal to sign Idrissa Gueye from Everton?

results.firPara: • Championship club choose ex-Birmingham coach to replace Steve McClaren
results.secPara: Gary Rowett has been confirmed as the new Derby County manager after the Championship club moved quickly to replace Steve McClaren, who was sacked on Sunday evening. Although other candidates have come forward, Rowett was always favourite for the position and ticks all the boxes in the eyes of the Derby board.
results.webTitle: Gary Rowett appointed as new Derby County manager

results.firPara: • Manchester United manager defends gesture at Stamford Bridge crowd
results.secPara: José Mourinho hit back at Antonio Conte and a section of the home support by insisting Judas is still No1 at Chelsea as Manchester Uniteds defence of the FA Cup came to a juddering halt at the hands of his former club.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho hits back at Chelsea fans and Conte: ‘Judas is still No1’

results.firPara: Pedro Caixinha lacks familiarity with Scottish football but understands the scepticism regarding his sudden prominence within it. On his unveiling as the head coach of Rangers on Monday the Portuguese asked for time from those who harbour doubts before identifying European glory as a legitimate target. With Rangers in their current state, that goal will trigger further scorn from elsewhere.
results.secPara: I faced the same situation when I went to Mexico, Caixinha said of external negativity. I would just say one thing at least give us the benefit of the doubt. Let us work. Then they can evaluate our work. We are exposed to it, not just here but all the football coaches in the world – theyre all in this situation. Its even bigger here because were at Rangers.
results.webTitle: Pedro Caixinha places glory in Europe at forefront of grand Rangers plans

results.firPara: • Fawaz al-Hasawi would still retain significant share in Championship club
results.secPara: Evangelos Marinakis, the infamous owner of Olympiakos, is holding secret talks with Nottingham Forest to join forces with Fawaz al-Hasawi and bring his own kind of leadership to a club flirting with relegation to English footballs third tier.
results.webTitle: Olympiakos owner Evangelos Marinakis in Nottingham Forest takeover talks

results.firPara: Emre Can believes he is over the debilitating calf injury that has affected his performances over the past 12 months and insisted he is happy to stay at Liverpool, despite having yet to agree an extension to his contract.
results.secPara: The Germany midfielder scored his fourth Premier League goal of the season in the 2-1 victory over Burnley on Sunday as Jürgen Klopps side recorded a third straight Premier League win at Anfield to maintain their place in the top four.
results.webTitle: Emre Can pain-free after niggling injury and happy to stay at Liverpool
